pages.transcription:
Diary
Edward A Barnes
From, W.H.W.

Wednesday, January 1, 1873.
Mild. With the blessing of God I hope to gain great success this year as a Hymn & Song writer.

Saturday February 4 1873
Weather mild & pleasant.
Mother better - but hardly able to sit up. Received a characteristic letter from Prof. Blim. His "Sunshine" to be out by the 1st of March

SUNDAY 5
A cold stormy Sabbath for the first of the new year. Felt bad all day. 
Opened my old Bible at random and read:
"Be of good cheer - wait I say on the Lord"
Psalm 27
MONDAY 6
Father at home seeing about his coal. Della began school again as a 3rd Grade scholar
Lillias signed the fly leaf of this Diary for me.

Mr Greg spent the evening with me

TUESDAY, JANUARY 7, 1873
Done some copying and wrote my song "Harvest Time". Della copied for me in the evening 
had company again in the evening.
Mother not feeling much better
WEDNESDAY 8
Weather - bitter cold. 
Della had her new Geography. Sent the following efforts to Mr Bliss.

"Onward"
"Drifting"


THURSDAY 9
Weather - Still very cold. For the want of a better term, I copy this:
FAME
The way to fame is like the way to heaven - through much Tribulation.

FRIDAY JANUARY 10 1873
Weather - Still very cold.

 Copied Harvest Time again. Hope I have got it right now, as I want to send it away next week.
Wish mother felt better & father out of trouble.

SATURDAY 11
Weather - quite pleasant again & moderating fast.
Glad am I. Better satisfied with this weeks work & duties than i did last Saturday night. Dont know what to think of Prof. Abbey

SUNDAY 12
Weather - quite mild

Miss Graves sent me a ticket to the West Side Libary for another year.
My ubscription expires Jan 11th 74

Weather - Damp and Cloudy
Recieved $3.00 from O. P. Bliss.
Glad I am able to help father a little, who came home almost sick, with a hard cold.

Recieved a long letter from Aunt Kissy.


TUESDAY 14
Weather - Dreary. Looked like snow all day, which came at night.
Wrote two letters. Not very fond of sea stories, but find 'The Pilot' rather interesting.
Rained all night.

WEDNESDAY 15
Weather - Mild, but cloudy.
Bad for colds and coughs. Old winter is half gone today and glad am I. Wrote another letter.
Billie had a call from Nellie Clarke.

THURSDAY JANUARY 16 1873
Weather = much colder and rather gloomy. Heard from Aunt Livey. The burning of the First Congregational Church occurred in the evening.
"Thy Will be Done"

FRIDAY 17
Weather - Cold and Stormy

 Had one of my thinking days when I dont feel like doing anything but think, think, think. Recieved a letter. Lillie quite unwell in the evening


SATURDAY 18
Lillie drew me a nice book from the library. Della attended a party at Miss Riffley's.
Wrote a letter
Another week goes by & still not a word from Mr. Abbey

SUNDAY, JANUARY 19,1873.
Weather - Cold and Stormy

Father had company. Committed to memory these passages and Prophecym Chapter 4-7-+

How impressive is their impact.
MONDAY 20
Weather - much milder
Did not feel quite as well as usual. Sent this effort to PP Bliss:
"Harvest Time"
Della borrowed that book for me 'Ethelym's Mistakes"
TUESDAY 21
Weather - we're dry enough after the heavy falls of snow last night. Did not feel well enough to write but finished my library book lucid. A Splendid book.

WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 22 1873
Wrote antr new hymn - "Walking on the shore"
Wrote a letter. God bless Mr. Rockwell for the deed of kindness that he did my father this day

THURSDAY 23
Weather - A furious Snow Storm
Snowed & drifted all day long. The gale blew down the rear walls of our church which did some damage.
A winter's night.
FRIDAY 24
Weather - not very cold but stormy day. Don't expect to get over this cold of mine til Spring comes.
This is my birthday

SATURDAY, JANUARY , 1873
Weather - Much milder
Della borrowed Dickens' Bleak House for me because she did not go to the library
Copied "Watching on the Shore"

SUNDAY 26
Weather - Pleasant, but cold.
Had company at dinner and, in the evening too. How I wish I could spend these Sabbaths as I ought to.

MONDAY 27
weather cold. 
Disappointed in not hearing from Mr Bliss.
Another visit from Mr. Gray
Lillie out to tea and Della had company at home.

TUESDAY, JANUARY 28,1873
Weather - =A cold day, So they say=
This is the last week in January

WEDNESDAY 29
Weather - another cold, stinging day. Got off my two letters at last.

Did not feel very well & went to bed with a re-ocurr headache

THURSDAY 30
Weather - Quite mild
Did some copying. Hope I shall derive some benefit from Beecher's Sermons that Della brought me from the library.

FRIDAY, JANUARY 31, 1873
Weather - Quite pleasant
Mother not very well.
Lillie did some copying for one much interested in Beecher's sermons. its great work.
SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 1
Weather - another snow storm which cleared off very cold.
The girls spent the afternoon and evening at Mrs Winter's four weeks from today is the first of Spring.

SUNDAY 2
Weather - A cold Sabbath.
Wanted to read my sermons but could not - so much company, Managed however to read a chapter and to commit to memory my usual verses as would elsewhere

MONDAY, FEBRUARY 3, 1873
Weather - cold, wet & raining.

 Sent Prof. Bliss the following effort

=Watching from the Shore+

 Hope to hear from that gentleman soon.


TUESDAY 4
Weather - pleasant but cold.

  For the want of a better item I quote=

=The excesses of youth are drafts upon old age. Payable with interest about thirty years after date" Colton

WEDNESDAY 5
Weather - Clear & pleasant
Wrote more new effort = 

Song for the Spring
Received a letter, but not from the scource that I expected.

THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 6, 1873
Weather - mild and very pleasant.
Copied and altered the effort I wrote yesterday. Another book from the Library. "Melbank"
Father recieved a letter from Uncle Augustus.

FRIDAY 7
Weather - pleasant a flurry o snow which cleared off very cold.
Spent a portion of the day reading "Millbank"
Had over [unreadable] at company in the evening

SATURDAY 8
Weather= cold & rather stormy

 Copied my song again.
       Recieved my expected letter from Prof. H. which I answered at once.

SUNDAY, FEBRUARY 9, 
Weather - a pleasant Sabbath.
Had our usual company to dinner. Spent the Holy Sabbath, not as I wanted to, 
but as circumstances bade one to do.

MONDAY 10
Weather - mild, but cloudy. 

This is the Anniversary of Fathers and Mothers wedding day.

Next Friday is St Valentines Day.

TUESDAY 11
Weather - A very pleasant day.
Wrote two letters and finished "Milbank" which is a first-rate story.
Did not hear from Mr. Bliss as I expected to

WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 12, 1873.
Weather - Cloudy and cold.

Recieved a kind letter from Mr Bliss. No more efforts for him at least for a spell.

Think I shall go on and write just the same.

THURSDAY 13
Weather - another cold disagreeable day. 
Della spent the evening at the house of a young friend.
Valentines Day tomorrow.

FRIDAY 14
Weather - Mild but cloudy.
Another book from the library 'Dora Deane' Della had eight valentines.
Got the idea of another hymn in my head.

SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 15, 1873
Weather - not very pleasant.
Got off my two business letters, recieved a call from Miss Riffly. Della had company in the evening.
Father brought our new carving knife and fork.

SUNDAY 16
Weather - Quite pleasant, not withstanding a cold, raw wind. 
Had our usual company to dinner & spent the day in my usual manner.
Della did not go to Sunday school.

MONDAY 17
Weather - a beautiful day.
Seems like Spring.
Finished the book of Joshua & wrote my new effort:
"Our Refuge"

TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 18, 1873
Weather - Another beautiful day.
Recieved two letters. Mr. Whitney sent me his "Musical Guest"
also 100 specimen pages. That contained my hymn "Wandering Home"

WEDNESDAY 19
Weather - Still very pleasant.
Did some copying. Papa came home very early to supper
which is quite unusual for him.

THURSDAY 20
Weather - Dark and Cloudy with a snowstorm in the afternoon
Wrote to Mr Abbey

FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1873
Weather - a cold day
Had company to dinner.
Sent to Prof. Abbey this old song of mine, "The Dying Girl"

SATURDAY 22
Weather - bitter cold.
Washington's birth-day.
Re-copied my hymn "Our Refuge" & wrote my new song "Our Jessie" or; "The angels are calling".

SUNDAY 23
Weather - a cold wintery Sabbath.

Had out usual company - both to dinner & in the evening.

Della absent from Sunday School.

MONDAY, FEBRUARY 24, 1873.
Weather - clear and cold.
Della had her photograph taken, don't think they are very good.
Saturday is the first day of Spring,
Suppose we will have our usual snow-storm.

TUESDAY 25
Weather - Pleasant but cold winds.
Finished my library book at last. Thing it was a good story. 
Della took a long walk on business for papa.

WEDNESDAY 26
Weather - another snow storm.
Wrote a long letter to Mr Bliss
which I hope will get me another 
chance to write.
High wind a night.

THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 27, 1873
Weather - a cold morning.
Another fall of snow, with more sleighing.
Commenced 'A brave lady' which Della borrowed for me.

FRIDAY 28
Weather - mild & pleasant.
Wrote to Cousin Emeline.
Mr Grey gave me two large maps & a nice ink stand.
He spent the evening with us.
SATURDAY, MARCH 1
Weather - quite mild, with a flurry of snow towards night.
Finished 'A brave lady' The story is good but think I could have to it in half the words.

SUNDAY, MARCH 2, 1873.
Weather - a stormy Sabbath.
Had our usual company and spent the day as I generally do.
"In your patience possess ye your souls"

MONDAY 3
A cold day.

Papa recieved a Pittsfield paper from Uncle Augustus.

Lillie going to the theatre tomorrow night.
TUESDAY 4
Weather - Bright & Clear.
Recieved a letter of introduction from Mr Bliss to Mr Murray, Andover, Mass.
Wrote to him at once.

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 5, 1873
Weather - a pleasant day.
Sent my letter to Mr Murray  & wrote to Mr Perkins. Hope to recieve 
favourable answers to them both in due seasons.

THURSDAY 6
Weather - another beautiful day. Finished 'Edna Browning' - a good book.
Father brought home The Railroad Scrap Book & also a card of hymns

FRIDAY 7
Weather - wet & rainy with March winds.
Wrote to Uncle Augustus

SATURDAY, MARCH 8, 1873
Weather - very pleasant
Suffered all day with a sore tooth.
Della had a call from Matie Reed in the afternoon

SUNDAY 9
Weather - Storm & sunshine the order of the day.
Father & Lillie on the sick list
A visit from Mr Grey as usual

MONDAY 10
Weather - Bright & clear.
Recieved 2 Pittsfield Papers from Cousin Erin.
Got a book from the library

TUESDAY, MARCH 11, 1873
Weather - pleasant with March winds.
Recieved a letter from Mr Perkins, who gives me another chance to write.
May I improve it in the right sense of the word.
WEDNESDAY 12
Weather - another beautiful day. Did some copying.
Had quite a fire right across the way from us. 
Lillie had a call from Nellie Clark
THURSDAY 13
Weather - Still very pleasant
Sent Mr. Perkins these efforts:
'Watching on the Shore'
'Song for the Spring'
How glad I am for this chance to write again.

FRIDAY, MARCH 14, 1873
Weather - Mild but cloudy.
2 murderers meet their doom today.
Recieved a call from Mr Horton

SATURDAY 15
Weather - A Spring day with high March winds.
Della had another call from Matie Reed

SUNDAY 16
A Spring Sabbath. Mild and pleasant.
Recieved the "Sunshine" from Mrs Bliss & 2 papers from Miss Ripley

MONDAY, MARCH 17, 1873.
Weather - very pleasant.
Mr Hollton took supper with us. Had more company
than we expected in the evening.
St Patrick's Day
TUESDAY 18
Weather - Still very pleasant.

Received a letter from Mr Perkins

who wants to know my price per effort.
The evening mail brought me a good letter from Cousin
Emeline.
WEDNESDAY 19
Weather - cloudy with a slight fall of rain
Wrote my new effort -
"Our Golden Song"
Lillie did some shopping

THURSDAY, MARCH 20, 1873
Weather - More snow.
Wrote to Mr. Abbey & Mr Perkins.
Went to the "Old Folks" concert. Della
went with me.
FRIDAY 21
Weather - pleasant but high winds
Another call from Mr Horton.
Received a letter from Mr Murray.
SATURDAY 22
Weather - pleasant, Copied my new hymn "Our Golden Song" Mr Wriley treated to oysters for supper. Papa had three pittsfield papers from Uncle Augustus.

SUNDAY, MARCH 23, 1873
Weather - a pleasant Sabbath
Had Mr Wiley, Mr Grey & Mr Horton to dinner

Committed to memory a portion of the Sunday School lesson for today

Genesis 28-10-22
MONDAY 24
Weather - rather stormy.

Received a kind letter from Aunt Kittie. Read same & thought a great deal more.

Snow in the evening.
TUESDAY 25
Weather - a regular mid-winters snow storm.
Received a letter from Mr Bliss - what a good man he is!
A wild winters night

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 26, 1873
Weather - More snow. & more sleighing. Della took the part of 'Little Mary' in Ten Nights in a "Balloon" at the Washingtonian home.
Mr Horton gave her $3.00 for her services
THURSDAY 27
Weather - Bright & Clear
Wrote my new hymn 'Long of Praise'
Next Tuesday is the 1st of April
FRIDAY 28
Weather - Dark & somewhat rainy,
Della bought her new shoes with her own money.
Another book from the library

SATURDAY, MARCH 29, 1873.
Weather - quite pleasant
Copied & altered my new effort - "Song of Praise"
Lillie bought her bridal dress. Mr Grey spent the evening with us
SUNDAY 30
Weather - a rainy afternoon
Had our usual company.
Found it quite difficult to preform my devotions.
Miss Ripley sent me a "Christian Union"
MONDAY 31
Weather - mild & pleasant
Heard from Abbey - more promises. Cannot help
but like him for the popularity he is giving my songs

TUESDAY, APRIL 1, 1873.
Weather - a stormy day - snow & rain

Copied my hymn once more. Mr Trilej took supper with us

WEDNESDAY 2
Weather - pleasant

Father recieved another Pittsfield Paper from Uncle Augustus

Got another book from the library
THURSDAY 3
A spring day 
Heard from Mr Perkins - one piece accepted.
Sent for the "Silver Song"

FRIDAY, APRIL 4, 1873
Weather - pleasant & warm

Sent my letter to Cousin Em, & bought Lillie & Della

each a pritty box.

Expect to recieve my book on Monday

SATURDAY 5
Weather - Spring in earnest,
Windows & doors all open.
Heavy rain at night that made sad work for us
Mr Grey spent the night with us,
SUNDAY 6
Weather - a dark, wet rainy Sabbath.
Does God blame us when we cannot serve
Him as we ought do?

Lillie & Della spent the night away

Monday April 7, 1873
Weather - quite pleasent. Bought another concert ticket and I am going to give that to mother
Tuesday 8
Weather - snow, wind and rain. The order of the day. Papa had a paper from Uncle Augustus. My book did not come
Wednesday 9
Weather, more snow. Sang to Mr. Perkins "Our Golden Song - Whatever is right" Concert unclearunclear

Thursday, April 10, 1873
Weather - pleasant
Bella had a present of a nice pair of kid gloves. Mother and the girls went to the "Old Folks Concert"
Friday 11
Weather - pleasant but unclear showers. Another book from the library. Had a call from Mis unclear unclear Don't see why the "Silver Song" doesn't come
Saturday 12
Weather - bright and pleasant
Wrote my new hymn "Come at the Call" Tasted some unclear bread Mr. Wiley left us to be gone three weeks.

Sunday, April 13, 1873
Weather - mild and pleasant. A beautiful Sabbath. My "Star of Glory" was sung by unclear Church choir this morning. God gives me blessings that I do not deserve. 
Monday 14
Weather. Pleasant. Heard from Mr Perkins. He paid me a high compliment but wants no more Hymns at present. sent my unclear to Mr Abbey
Tuesday 15
Weather More rain which unclear of nice. Wrote to H.S. Perkins. Hope he will let me write songs for him if not religious effort. Papa found a handsome sleeve-button.

Wednesday, April 16, 1873
Weather - chilly and somewhat rainy. Lillie received a letter from Mr Wiley. Wrote to Mr Whitney about my "Silver Song" which has not come unclear In trust a good story
Thursday 17
Weather - snow snow and more rain. Going to make a bold effort to get out to church if God favors it, I shall succeed. Another book from tthe Library
Friday 18
Weather - still wet and raining. Heard from Mr Perkins. he gives a chance to write songss for him and sent a leter of introduction to J.H. unclear Georgetown_Mass

Saturday, April 19
Weather. Very pleasent. 
Heard from Mr. Whitney. unclear I unclear unclear my "Silver Songs"
Sunday 20
A Splendid Sabbath. 
I've had calls from Mr. Haston. Mr Grey. Mellie V. Carrie Clark. Mother heard a lecture on Spiritualism. 
Monday 21
Weather. More snow. unclear night. Wrote to Mr unclear I got my Hymn ready to send to him in the morning

Tuesday, April 22, 1873
Weather - rather stormy. Sent my Hymns "Song of Praise" to unclear. Wrote to Mr Perkins. Father at home, having a rest
Wednesday 23
Weather - pleasant but cold. Mrs. Orton called on me. She is going to interest herself in my carriage unclear. I know that God will reward her for this Christian act
Thursday 24
Weather - a snow storm. Mr Wiley came home quite unexpectedly. heard from Mr Abbey more promises. "Songs for the Bible" to be out this 1st of May.
